questions.text: This is the first episode in which we see Harry the Hat. Who played Harry?
questions.explanation:
Harry Anderson.

	Harry Anderson was born on Oct. 14, 1952. He is best known for his role as Judge Harry Stone on "Night Court". He is not only a great actor but a magnificent magician as well.

Fred Dryer.

	Fred Dryer was the first choice to play Sam Malone. He is best known for his role as the title character in "Hunter".

Yes.

	He hit on Diane telling her how great he was, when Sam responded, "and incredibly married." Diane was disappointed; she wanted to turn him down solely on his personality.

questions.text: What did Sam say he borrowed from Dave?
questions.explanation:
"two young dollars".

	Dave was about to say he loaned him two young women when Diane walked by. Sam quickly said, "two young dollars". When Diane questioned it he replied, "I hate when they're wrinkled."

questions.text: Who didn't want Sam to do the interview?
questions.explanation:
Diane.

	Diane felt like those retired sports star interviews were depressing. When Dave ended up doing another interview with someone else, Sam did feel depressed.

questions.text: What did Diane tell Sam he was sometimes when the light hit him right?
questions.explanation:
"Some what unrepugnant ".

	Sam replied, "Yes that's what the women call me: tall, dark and unrepugnant." Early in these episodes we could already see there was some chemistry between Sam and Diane.

questions.text: Who did Sam say Diane should feel sorry for?
questions.explanation:
The Flintstones.

	According to Sam, "The Flintstones" was on at 6pm. He said that when everyone found out Sam Malone was giving an interview, "Bedrock is going to be one lonely city."

questions.text: What was Sam's nickname from his baseball days?
questions.explanation:
Mayday Malone.

	Sam said his nickname to Diane when he mentioned "The Flintstones". Mayday Malone was a relief pitcher for the Red Sox before he had to retire due to a drinking problem.

questions.text: Who did Harry con out of money in the middle of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Norm.

	Harry said he was practicing his trick of suspending a coin in mid-air. Norm said he couldn't do it. Harry turned it around and said, "You're gonna give me ten bucks if I can't do it." Of course he couldn't so he made ten bucks off of Harry.

questions.text: Dave did not finish the interview with Sam. Who did he go to interview instead?
questions.explanation:
John McEnroe.

	Sam went to the pool room wanting to be alone. Diane followed him and they talked about how disappointment feels. Sam wanted Diane to leave before they talked but she didn't take the hint and refused to leave. This was also the first episode in which Sam kissed Diane.
